title: So uh... why exactly do Zyra's plants and Azir's soldiers get the 40% slow out of Rylai's?
body:
Seriously. Like, Azir's soldiers I could *maybe* understand, cuz they're sorta not summoned minions (i mean, they pretty much are, but they're not targetable) but really even if they're not 'summoned minions' they're still certainly 'multi-hit' and should therefore be 20% on those grounds. Not to mention just for the sake of balance they shouldn't get the strong slow.

But Zyra's? By no means should they have ever gotten a 40% slow. They're clearly minions, not to mention 'multi-hit', yet for some reason they get to have the single-target slow. Cuz, you know, Zyra isn't already a giant middle finger to melees without getting a 40% permaslow from her plants.

Idk if there's any other minions getting preferential treatment, I haven't bothered to test them all, but I have at least seen that Malzahar's are treated properly and only get the 20% slow. I haven't really noticed feeling excessively-slowed by any other minions in my games (unlike with these two, which prompted me to finally test for myself), so I'm assuming these are the only two.



***Addendum**: tested out with Annie/Tibbers too, 20% slow for them (well, her ult gets 40% for 1 second on the initial cast cuz the upfront burst, but it's 20% from Tibbers himself). 

Tested out with Heimer too, his turret's regular attacks get 20%, but the beams and everything his ult turret does gets the 40%... kinda questionable as well, but at least it's more conditional for him and not 100% uptime.



Also, since a lot of people seem to misunderstand: Multi-hit =/= multi-target/aoe. Multi-hit means the skill can hit a given target multiple times with a single use, kinda like damage over time, though not necessarily with the same periodic nature. 

Whether or not Azir's soldiers are really summoned minions, they ARE pretty undeniably able to get multiple hits out of a single ability use, so yeah, they really ought to get the '20% for 1 second" slow that multi-hit/dot abilities and summoned minions both are supposed to get.

How are Zyra plants multi-hit?

Do Heimer turrets get a 20% slow too? If you don't we can consider it fair that mobile summoned minions get 20% and stationary ones get 40%.

Zyra's plants are summoned pets.
Both Heimer's turrets and Zyra's plants can attack by themselves.
Heimer's turrets have the weakened 20% slow. Zyra's plants should have the same.
Also both of them are immobile, not sure what you mean.
The only mobile ones would be like, Elise's spider/Malz's voidlings/etc.

Heim's turrets last indefinitely and are immediately there upon spell cast. Zyra's plants have a limited lifespan and can be countered by stepping on the seeds before she casts the spell. I'm assuming that's the rationale behind them.

If we're gonna pick out little superiorities here as justification, Zyra won't win. 

While Heimer's turrets attack faster, Zyra's deal significantly more damage (34 base damage max for heimer, 109 for zyra, same ap rates), making them much more punishing even if they only touch you once (which they usually will, since they queue up an attack that gets to still strike you even if you get out of their range before they're fully summoned)

While plants beyond the first deal reduced damage, Zyra can have out a hell of a lot more than 3 at a time, especially with her new passive, and can summon them up much more frequently.

Zyra's plants can be summoned much much further away than Heimer's (450 range for Heimer, 850 on manually placing seeds for Zyra with 1000+ range for triggering them with her Q and E), while also having superior attack range (750 for thorn spitters, which is just batshit... most champs can't even attack her plants without being struck). Overall, she can hit with plants from around 1800 units away, compared to Heimer being able to hit from *maybe* 700ish range.

Zyra's plants are generally more durable than Heimer's turrets. Because of the overly-generous health system Zyra's plants use, it doesn't matter how much damage you throw at them, all that matters is the nature of the attack/spell you're throwing their way. In general, this keeps them alive much better than the standard health of Heimer's turrets, which often leaves turrets dying to a single mage's spell or an auto or two from an ADC (often from outside their attack range, no less).


Also, stepping on the seeds is a poor counter at best... for some reason, Zyra's given a generous grace period during which the seeds can be triggered by her, but can't be stepped on by opponents. So she can just place them and trigger them shortly after knowing the opponent can't do a thing about them. She's even able to place them directly under the enemy's feet and trigger them without them being destroyed first.



Anyway, point is, Zyra's plants are MUCH better pets than Heimer's regular turrets, in damn near every way, both on paper and in practice. So thinking she deserves for them to have a 40% slow too is just... wrong.

I was musing on wether immobile summoned minions universally applied a 40% slow, completely forgetting that Heimer's turrets are multi-hit (making them single target could be an idea for a rework, actually).

People aren't saying it... they aren't.

They are summoned minions.  They can hit a single target at a time and each one provides a slow, I'm not certain if they stack though.  It does say if a spell fits multiple categories it takes the lowest so it may just overwrite the slow on each hit (am curious here if anybody can test it).  But still they hit only one target each so they aren't multi-hit.

Um... you cast them once and they hit multiple times. 


Multi-hit =/= Multi-target. Multi-hit means a cast of a spell (can) hit the same target multiple times... think like a DoT, but not necessarily with rapid (or evenly periodic) damage instances. Like Viktor's ult pulses, for example.

So yes, Zyra's plants are certainly 'multi-hit', as are Azir's soldiers, and pretty much every summoned minion. You cast them once, and they have the potential to hit many times. And that being the case, they should still get the '20% slow for 1 second from multi-hit or DoT' from Rylai's even if for some reason they're exempt from the '20% slow for 1 second from summoned minions'

Azir, I don't know why. Like Heimerdinger, his W only conjures the minion, and doesn't do anything else, so it should follow the same rules for Heimerdinger's Q.

Zyra, conversely, falls under a different set of rules. Her Q and W are both actual spells, with the plants being bound specifically to landing those spells on pods. I think they treat spell effects differently is because of this tie to being actual offensive spells.

No, not really.
Azir's soldiers aren't independent minions.
They're not targetable, nor can they think or behave or act or attack by themselves.
They're literally just an auto-attack range extension/piercing modifier.

Zyra's plants are attackable and killable and can also behave independently even without Zyra, hence, they should be treated as pets.

Azir's soldiers are basically just his extended auto-attacks that can penetrate through multiple units instead.
Hence, multiple units = AoE -> 40% slow.
They also can't attack by themselves.

Zyra's plants along with every other champion summoned unit can all attack by themselves, and are thus considered to be "independent", hence, a pet.
Hence, a weakened slow. Except Zyra's doesn't follow that rule for whatever reason.
Meh, Riot logic.

extended auto-attacks doesn't justify him getting the 40%. Even if they're not considered pets (and btw they're not simply 'extended autos', otherwise they'd apply attack procs, not spell procs), they're still multi-hit + AoE, meaning they should get the weaker of the two slows, a 20% slow for 1 second.
You do know that the stronger slow always overrides the weaker one, right? By your logic, since it's AOE, the 40% slow has priority over the 20% one.

You do know that Rylai's explicitly states that if something falls into more than one category, the weaker slow is used, right? My logic is perfectly in accordance with the stated game mechanics.

In fact, if Rylai's worked the way you just stated, there would NEVER be 20% slows on ANYTHING, since everything is either single-target or aoe, and therefore the 20% slow for DoTs/multi-hit/summons would always cede to a 40% slow from single-target or aoe for every single damage source in the game.


Always amazes me how people can't even be bothered to read the simple text on items.
Are you aware that a 40% slow is the stronger one, therefore from your logic it would always be a 20% slow.

My point is that if it worked like the guy I'm responding to stated (i.e. Rylai's *didn't* have that explicit line stating the weakest slow is used when something fits more than 1 category, and therefore always used the strongest like in 'normal' slow stacking), then there would never be 20% slows from Rylai's, cuz everything is either single-target or AoE.

Again, nothing even remotely comparable.

A) Yasuo's Q can't apply Rylai's, it doesn't apply spell procs.

B) Yasuo's strikes once with a single ability usage, meaning even if it were able to apply spell procs, it wouldn't be multi-hit. Azir's can strike as many times as his attack speed will allow from a single ability usage, i.e. it should be considered multi-hit.
Hey, you know what we could do? Revert some of his nerfs if we apply this one. Just an option.

aoe=/= multi-hit. Multi-hit is an ability that can hit the same target multiple times, and those get a 20% slow for 1 second with rylai's, 'AoE' simply refers to anything that can hit multiple targets (even if it's not technically an 'area') and that gets a 40% slow for 1 second normally, but gets dropped down to 20% if it also happens to be multi-hit/DoT or a summon. Azir's W could be debatable whether it's really a summon, but it is certainly multi-hit, so it's a moot point; it should be 20%.
Area-of-effect and multiple hits are not the same thing.
Azir's soliders are AOE because of the pierce
Zyras plants count as the AOE slow, not the single target 40% one. they've aways been like that.
